io

Class SystemPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.SystemPacket

  • public class SystemPacket
extends java.lang.Object
    IO Package: SystemPacket is constantly sent to the tanks in order to provide state change information to the tanks in order to account for user manipulations. SystemPacket receives data from the class Main when the keyboard input given is pressed/released by the user from player one or player two. Once it is received system packet calls each method depending on which key is pressed/released by the user. Once it calls the method, SystemPacket sends back information to the Main, helping player one and two to function properly depending on the command.
    Version:
    May 26, 2018
    Author:
    Maithreyee Vatsan, Period: 2, Assignment: Tanks t-34 destroyers final Project, Sources: Nikash Walia, Roopak Phatak, Maithreyee Vatsan

      SystemPacket(boolean fire, int turn, int move, int gunTurn)
      SystemPacket is constantly sent to the tanks in order to provide state change information to the tanks in order to account for user manipulations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean calledFire()
      the method, calledFire(), is called when the system packet receives data to fire the gun
      int calledGunTurn()
      the method, calledGunTurn(), is called when the system packet receives data to turn the gun turret (the gun on top of the tank)
      int calledMove()
      the method, calledMove(), is called when the system packet receives data to move the tank
      int calledTurn()
      the method, calledTurn(), is called when the system packet receives data to turn the tank

    • Constructor Detail

      • SystemPacket

        public SystemPacket(boolean fire,
                    int turn,
                    int move,
                    int gunTurn)
        SystemPacket is constantly sent to the tanks in order to provide state change information to the tanks in order to account for user manipulations. SystemPacket receives data from the class Main when the keyboard input given is pressed/released by the user from player one or player two. Once it is received system packet calls each method depending on which key is pressed/released by the user. Once it calls the method, SystemPacket sends back information to the Main, helping player one and two to function properly depending on the command. constructor for SystemPacket
        Parameters:
        fire - boolean variable, fire, used to assess whether the gun should fire when called
        turn - int variable, turn, used to assess whether the tank should turn when called
        move - int variable, move, used to assess whether the tank should move when called
        gunTurn - int variable, gunTurn, used to assess whether the gun turret should turn when called
